answerText: radial velocity[10] This quantity, symbolized mu, is the apparent change of a star on the celestial sphere and is measured in arc-seconds per year. Barnard's star has the largest measure for this quantity.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | VCU + Michigan State  | 20 | Science | Other | College
subject: Science
question: Question: The vast majority of extrasolar planets have been discovered by measuring variations in this quantity in a technique also known as the Doppler method or Doppler spectroscopy. For 10 points each: [10] Name this quantity that is the velocity of an object along an observer's line-of-sight.
